Today we have the honor of thanking three generations of health care workers who have continued to step up during this pandemic.

RHS Class of 1969 Micki (Hall) Wheaton after retiring from 35 years as MSN/RN at VA Hospital System is volunteering and sewing masks for ProMedica.

Her daughter Jennifer (Wheaton) Galliers, RHS Class of 1990, is a DNP/APRN working with ProMedica System COVID Incident Management Team in Senior Nursing Leadership and providing palliative care as APRN for Hospice of Northwest Ohio.

Her daughter, and Micki's granddaughter, Autumn Wheaton Rodriguez (RHS Class of 2015) is a BSN/RN who is caring for patients on the frontline at Ohio State University in their brain and spine hospital.

We are so grateful for these Rossford graduates using their talents to help others. Thank you for your families' commitment to the community and health of others.

Rossford Schools
March 22 at 7:31 PM ·

In light of the upcoming 'Stay Home' order from Governor Mike DeWine, which will take affect at midnight Monday, we are allowing parents and guardians to pick up devices from noon to 6 p.m. tomorrow, Monday, March 23rd to assist in the home learning environment for our K-12 students. Devices for elementary students will need picked up at Rossford Elementary School. Devices for 6-12 students will be picked up at the High School entrances. A simple identification question about the student will be required for pickup.

This is an optional pick up, if you prefer to stay home and/or have capable devices at home that is perfectly acceptable to use.

View this video message from Superintendent Creps for more information on the pick up tomorrow.

We appreciate your quick responsiveness on this last-minute endeavor for our students' education.

We appreciate your patience as we have worked to provide meals for those in need.

Rossford Schools is pleased to partner with Northwood Schools as they are prepping meals in their kitchen and distributing meals to families at Brentwood Park (300 Brentwood Drive, Northwood, OH, 43619).

The distribution will be from 11 a.m. to 11:45 a.m. Wednesday through Friday this week. It will pick back up on weekdays beginning March 30th at the same time and location. Our Rossford Schools families are welcome to come and pick up meals for their children at this distribution.

Rossford Schools is donating food and will offer volunteer support to Northwood Schools as we work together for this meal giveaway.

We are grateful for Northwood Local Schools leading this project and partnering with us to offer meals to both school communities. It is important our children in need receive food, but we also are aiming to limiting our contact to stop the spread of this virus. This partnership helps us achieve both goals.

We are so proud of our Rossford High School Marching Band! For the second consecutive season the band qualified for states after earning a Superior Rating at a competition at Swanton this weekend. The band also won first place in Class B, and earned Grand Champion for first place overall for show. This is the first time Rossford has achieved this. This performance capped off an undefeated regular season for the band in Class B. The Marching Band is off to the state finals at the University of Dayton, on Nov. 10 at 5 p.m. It will be in Welcome Stadium.

"This is really exciting because only a few groups get to participate across the state in each class," Band Director Justin Kelley said. "Back to back years doing that is a huge honor. The kids have been working hard toward this goal."

It was a wonderful Friday night at Jackson-Ferguson Stadium. Before the game Rossford High School was honored with a Purple Star Award Ceremony. Representatives from the Ohio Department of Education and even Governor Mike DeWine's office stopped by to say kind words to our Serving Our Soldiers Club and community. Rossford High School was given a banner, military challenge coin, plaque, and commendation from Rep. Ghanbari. We're thankful for the officials coming down from Columbus for the ceremony.

Three RHS graduates were inducted until the RHS Hall of Fame during a halftime ceremony. Inductees were Mike Kornasiewicz of the RHS Class of 1985, Rachael (Clay) Waltz of the RHS Class of 2008, and Adam Whitlatch of the RHS Class of 1994.

Don't forget our football team defeated Genoa 28-7. Thank you for coming out and supporting our Bulldogs!
